Which MFM-300 material shows the highest isothermal uptake but demonstrates the maximum retention of NH3 under dynamic conditions?
data.answer: MFM-300(VIII) exhibits the highest isothermal uptake, but MFM-300(VIII) demonstrates the maximum retention of NH3 under dynamic conditions.

What is the effect of NH3 adsorption on the framework bands of MFM-300(Fe) as observed in FTIR spectra?

data.answer: The role of pore size, ligand functionalization, and exposed metal sites is crucial for high capacity hydrogen adsorption in Cu(II) tetracarboxylate framework materials as they significantly enhance hydrogen uptake.

What is the oxidation state of the V center in MFM-300(VIV) before and after NH3 adsorption as investigated by EPR?
data.answer: The oxidation state of the V center in MFM-300(VIV) decreases significantly upon NH3 adsorption, suggesting the reduction of VIV to VIII centers.

data.question: True or False: The INS technique is subject to optical selection rules.
What is the main advantage of using INS to study the dynamics of adsorbed NH3 molecules within MFM-300 materials?
data.answer: The main advantage of using INS is its ultra-sensitivity to the vibrations of hydrogen atoms, making it ideal for studying the dynamics of adsorbed NH3 molecules.

data.question: True or False: MFM-300 materials show an increase in isothermal uptakes with decreasing temperature.
What is the role of the bridging hydroxyl group in the adsorption of NH3 in MFM-300 materials?
data.answer: The bridging hydroxyl group plays a crucial role in the adsorption of NH3 in MFM-300 materials through hydrogen bonding interactions with NH3 molecules.
